title: Super D Race at the Nevada State DH Championships
Nevada State DH Championship @ Bootleg Canyon
Mob in Mojave
description:
The Return of MOB in Mojave will challenge riders to ALL NEW COURSES for both the Downhill and Super D events. Our Title and Presenting sponsors, New Frontier Armory and All Mountain Cyclery are on board to provide riders with the best support available! 

    The Pro\'s will have an opportunity at $2000.00 of cold, hard, Vegas cash!
    Everyone gets 2 days of free shuttles ($10.00 for All Day Friday)
    Long sleeve MOB Shirts for all Racers.
    Chip Timing provided by Elemental Timing.
    USA Cycling Sanctioned.
course:
The New Super D course will be Boy Scout to Skyline to East Leg.
The New Downhill Course will be Armageddon to G-String.
registration:
Advanced Registration, Online until midnight 2/14*
Amateur Downhill: $75.00
Amateur Super D: $75.00
Both Races: Amateur: $125.00
Pro Downhill: $85.00
Pro Super D: $75.00
Both Races: Pro: $135.00 
*On site/late Registration will increase $20.00 per event.

notes:
Your registration fee “includes” shuttles on Saturday and Sunday! New Frontier Armory and Battlefield Vegas have got you covered in their Deuce ½ military vehicles. Riding in style.  Friday shuttles will cost just $10.00 for the entire day for racers and $20.00 for all non-racers.
Friday, February 15th:
9:00am: Packet Pick-up and late registration begins at Bootleg Canyon Mountain Bike Park.
-	Shuttles begin for pre riding both courses.  Shuttles will pick up at The Registration area, by the bathrooms. ALL registered riders will be issued a bracelet. This will be your shuttle pass. If a rider does not have a bracelet, one may be purchased for $20per day.  
4:00pm: Packet Pick-up and Registration Closes.
-	Last Shuttle leaves the Pick-up area for the last run of the day.

Saturday, February 16th:

8:00am: Packet Pick-up and late registration begins at Bootleg Canyon Mountain Bike Park.
-	Shuttles begin for pre riding both courses.  Shuttles will pick up at The Registration area, by the bathrooms. ALL registered riders will be issued a bracelet. This will be your shuttle pass. If a rider does not have a bracelet, one may be purchased for $20per day.  
10:00am: Super D registration Closed. Downhill onsite registration and Packet Pick up will remain open.
10:30am: Last Super D practice rider to start the course from the start. Course inspections will immediately follow. 
-	Super D START LIST will be posted at the Registration (Bathrooms) and in the Main Parking Area.
-	Shuttles for the Super D Start will begin.  Downhill course practice riding is allowed but please be aware that the Super D racers will have shuttle priority until all riders have made it to the Start line.
11:00am: Super D Race begins. All Riders will start at 1 minute intervals.  
1:00pm: Super D Race expected completion.
1:30pm: Super D Awards. 
2:30pm: Practice riding on Downhill Course CLOSED for Pro Seeding runs.
3:00pm: Pro Downhill seeding runs begin.
4:00pm: Downhill Course re-opens for Practice Runs.
4:20pm: Last Shuttle leaves the Pick up Area for the final practice run of the day. Official Sunset time is
                5:23pm. 

Sunday, February 17th:

8:00am: Registration and Packet Pick up opens.
-	Shuttles begin for all Practice Riding.
9:00am: Registration CLOSED.
9:30am: Start times posted for Downhill race.
10:30am: Downhill course closed for inspection.
11:00am: Downhill race STARTS.
2:00pm: Downhill race ends.
2:30pm: Downhill Awards Ceremony. 
4:00pm Shuttle Service ends.
directions:
US-93 to Yucca Street (Taco Bell is on the corner) in Boulder City.
Turn on Yucca and follow straight to the mountain. Follow event signs.

title: Reaper Madness SD @ Bootleg Canyon
description: This event is the 1st Pro GRT event of the season. 3 full days of gravity racing with shuttle service. Friday will be open practice. Saturday will be open practice from 9:00 am until 11:00 am with the SD race starting sharply at 12 noon.
course: Course is all single-track, mostly downhill with a couple of flat sections and finishes in Race Village near the DH finish. Racers will be released one at a time in 30 second or 1 minute increments. A 5  to 6 inch travel trail bike is perfect for this race. 1 course for all categories.
registration: Registration opens on Active.com on Monday January 21, 2013 for $75.00. On March 1 the price will increase by $10.00. Online registration closes on Sunday March 10, 2013. On-site registration will be at the venue on March 15, 16 & 17th until 2 hours prior the start of the race for $100.00.
directions: Boulder City, Nevada is located 23 miles from the Las Vegas Strip on US 93/95. Once in Boulder city just turn at the Taco Bell (Yucca st). Now look for the large letters \"BC\" on the mountain directly in front of you. There will also be signs saying \"To the race\". It\'s that easy!

title: Reaper Madness DH @ Bootleg Canyon
description: This Pro GRT event will be 3 days of shuttle service for plenty of open practice + 2 days of gravity racing. Friday will include shuttle service and open practice on both the DH and the SD race courses. Saturday will feature the SD race with the Pro Seeding run following for Sunday\'s main DH race. Sunday will have open DH practice in the morning with the DH race starting sharply at 11:00 am. Immediately after the DH race, we will host an Open Chainless DH race on the same course. The Awards Ceremony at 4:00 pm on Sunday will wrap up the long weekend event.
course: From the shuttle drop off point there is an 8 minute hike-a-bike to the DH race course start. This will be clearly marked on the course map & itinerary and Bootleg Canyon racers are well aware of this fact. The course is approx. 1.5 miles long, all downhill, all single-track, rough and technical on the top half and fast and relatively smooth for the lower half. 1 course for all categories and the finish is at Race Village.
registration: Online registration can be found on Active.com and will open on Monday January 21, 2013. Pricing will start at $75.00 from registration opening until March 1. From March 1 until online registration closes on Sunday March 10, the price will increase by $10.00. On-site registration will be open on March 15, 16 & 17 until 2 hours prior to the start of the race, and be $100.00. All registration fees include Saturday and Sunday shuttle service. Friday shuttle service will be available for an additional fee.
notes: We will be using the same timing and registration system that we used for the Nevada State DH Championships at the same venue this past January.
directions: Boulder City, Nevada (89005) is located 23 miles from the Las Vegas Strip on US 93/95. Once in Boulder City just turn at the Taco Bell (Yucca St). Look for the signs or for the large letters \"BC\" on the mountain. It\'s that easy!

title: Viva Bike Vegas 2013 Gran Fondo Pinarello
CLIF® Bar CrossVegas
description: CLIF ® Bar CrossVegas is the biggest cyclocross race in the U.S.
course: Desert Breeze Soccer Complex.  Complete information available in the Technical Guide online at www.crossvegas.com
registration: Online registration opens Tuesday August 6.  Complete eligibility requirements and procedures online at www.crossvegas.com.
directions: Directions to Desert Breeze Soccer Complex available in the Technical Guide online at www.crossvegas.com

title: Sierra Valley Grand Fondo
description: The Sierra Valley is a short drive from Reno and is one of the most picturesque landscapes in the area. The Reno Cycling Club is working with The Sierra Schools Foundation to host a truly unique cycling event. The proceeds of the Sierra Valley Gran Fundo will make a direct and meaningful impact on the educational experience and lives of hundreds of Sierra County school children. The financial support will further help to ensure that all school children in Sierra County have access to excellent public education that does not depend on geographic location, local economies or family income.
course:
Date: Saturday, September 21, 2013
Ride with GPS maps available at www.svgf.org

Enorme Fondo | 160 Miles | 11,243 ft. Elevation Gain | Start: 6:30 am
Cut Off: CS5 @ 1:30pm (Sunrise: 6:49am | Sunset: 7:00pm)

Gran Fondo | 96 Miles | 5,380 ft. Elevation Gain | Start: 8:00 am

Medio Fondo | 66 Miles | 775 ft. Elevation Gain | Start: 8:30 am

Piccolo Fondo | 33 Miles | 336 ft. Elevation Gain | Start: 9:00 am
registration: Online Registration at www.svgf.org. Day of registration will open at 5:30am. NO MAIL IN REGISTRATION
notes: At Registration or Packet Pick up, each rider will receive a bib number that must be pinned on rider exterior garment and accessible by Event Staff to record your bib number and stamp it at designated Check in Stations (CS#) (See Route Maps). Each bib number will have a tear off section that will be taken at the finish to document finish time. (DO NOT PIN TEAR OFF PORTION). To be eligible for an authenticated finish time, awards and prizes, all Check in Station stamps must be present including the MASS START Stamp to discourage riders leaving early. After Crossing the finish line, all riders must check in with ride FINISH OFFICIALS to have the bib number tear off collected and time stamped.
directions:
From Reno: Head north on I-580 N/US-395 N toward Susanville | Continue onto US-395 N Entering California | Take the CA-70 ramp to Portola/Quincy & Turn left onto CA-70 W| Turn left onto CA-49 S/Golden Chain Highway S/Vinton Loyalton Rd (signs for Loyalton 11) Continue to follow CA-49 S/Golden Chain Highway S | Entering Loyalton Turn right on 4th street | Proceed straight ahead as road ends at  Loyalton High School and Registration.
From Points West of Truckee, CA:  Entering Truckee on I-80 East bound, take exit 188A toward Truckee | Turn left onto Donner Pass Rd . | At the first traffic circle, continue straight to stay on Donner Pass Rd	
| At the second traffic circle, take the 3rd exit onto North bound on CA-89 | At the third traffic circle,  continue straight to stay on CA-89 for 22.6 mi | Turn right onto CA-49 N/Golden Chain Highway N/E Main St (signs for Loyalton) | Continue to follow CA-49 N/Golden Chain Highway N | Entering Loyalton Turn left on 4th street | Proceed straight ahead as road ends at Loyalton High School and Registration.
